lender.name: Teeraporn
lender.loan_because: Life is too short to ignore others people problem.
lender.occupational_info: My sales job is stressful... it's help me relax to see I can help others.

lender.name: Tobi und Eva
lender.loan_because: We want to share our luck!!!

lender.name: Gurlherleki
lender.loan_because: We're privileged to be able to lend, and are inspired by the opportunities Kiva creates. Plus, it's a way for our family members, living in two cities, to share a project together.
lender.occupational_info: Our family includes two mothers, a dentist, a personal chef, a university administrator, and a retired marketing manager.

lender.name: Rocco COM 101
lender.loan_because: This is a group donation from a public speaking class at Washtenaw Community College located in Ann Arbor, MI.
lender.occupational_info: College Students.

lender.name: Susanne Cologne Germany
lender.loan_because: Good idea.

lender.name: Dara
lender.loan_because: All people need anywhere is a little help. As Ghandi put it, You must be the change you want to see in the world.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a student at Syracuse University in New York, studying international relations and magazine journalism.

lender.name: Charles & Yiskah
lender.loan_because: I loan because it is the way to enable people to have more dignity and self-direction in their lives by gaining economic success. It is the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: I am the prospective Executive Director of Beth Shalom Synagogue in Edmonton, Alberta in Canada.

lender.name: Krissy
lender.loan_because: Even though I live off of a modest income I feel like any bit I can give can make a difference in someone else's life. I have been very fortunate in many ways and always seem to have just enough of what I need. I hope to be inspirational to others to help in any small way they can. $1 means something different to all of us.
lender.occupational_info: I work with a lot of families who have just experienced a huge loss. I love the fact I can give something back to them in such a time of need. I work to give them their last physical goodbye to their loved one. Oddly, it gives me a brighter outlook on life by dealing with death daily. Everyone should fall in love with life.

lender.name: Rick
lender.loan_because: free enterprise unlocks the doors to liberty, justice and progress.

lender.name: zach
lender.loan_because: i like to help people in need and because they need the money more than me.
lender.occupational_info: it is very fun and exiting!!

lender.name: never12die
lender.loan_because: I think I can be helpful
lender.occupational_info: Earn some while helping

lender.name: Daniel
lender.loan_because: I have a lot to be thankful for.
lender.occupational_info: I deal with manufacturing of clothing: making it all fit through measurements and paper patterns.

lender.name: Pat
lender.loan_because: I love how micro-lending flattens the world and helps people escape poverty.

lender.name: Amber
lender.loan_because: It promotes independence and personal responsibility. Also, it shows that we're not all the small minded ***holes that Bush presents us as. I prefer to loan through gift certificates to friends. I think it makes a unique gift and helps spread the word.

lender.name: Ashley
lender.occupation: Customer Development Manager for P&G Chemicals
lender.loan_because: I like to help and see people succeed.
lender.occupational_info: I work for P&G (Procter & Gamble) as an Account Executive and Customer Development Team Manager.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: The loans make a big difference to the recipients .

lender.name: Michael
lender.loan_because: Life is good, and our good fortune should be shared.
lender.occupational_info: I'm involved in selling high tech equipment to broadcasters.

lender.name: Lyn
lender.loan_because: so little money can make the world of difference to someone across the world.
lender.occupational_info: I teach 8 year olds in an International school in Shanghai, China.

lender.name: Kenneth
lender.loan_because: To share the wealth. To support my fellow man in need.

lender.name: Edie and George
lender.loan_because: We should all do our part to help others succeed in their dreams

lender.name: Su (without an e)
lender.loan_because: I was given many chances in life; it's time to give back.
lender.occupational_info: Work with school children with different disabilities be as successful as possible in school while having fun and feeling good about themselves.

lender.name: Steve
lender.loan_because: I believe in helping people who work for their families.
lender.occupational_info: I program computers for a major telephone company to help provide data services around the world.

lender.name: Andrea, Kelly, Kira, Dallas and Zack
Catherine
lender.occupation: Teacher Assistant and Full Time Student
lender.loan_because: I am taking a Geography course this summer and we watched a video on the impact of KIVA. It really touhed me and although I do not have much money to my name, I knew I had more than others and wanted to do my part to help.
lender.occupational_info: I am studying to be a teacher. Currently I work at a middle school outside of Nashville, Tennessee while attending a local university. I work with children with special needs in their classes. It has helped me to realize how much I want to reach my goals and become a teacher and counselor.

lender.name: Alicia & Ryan
lender.loan_because: I believe that you should 'Be the change that you want to see in the world'.
lender.occupational_info: Alicia: I work for an as a drafter for an architectural firm that designs universities and research facilities. Ryan: I work for a tech company as a software designer.

lender.name: Jason
lender.loan_because: There are so many areas of lending that have been underserved. Microfinance encourages entrepreneurial activity and lenders are provided a revolving door to monitor its impact.

lender.name: Shannon
lender.loan_because: it helps people improve their lives and, in turn, improves mine.

lender.name: Barbara
lender.loan_because: I would like to think that if I were the one in need of a loan, there would be someone there to help me.
lender.occupational_info: I have 2 jobs. I work in an office Monday - Friday in the payroll office of a large company, and in my spare time I am a writer. I write advertising, articles and newsletters for businesses.

lender.name: Debbie
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference.

lender.name: Yvonne in Scotland
lender.loan_because: It makes such good sense for us to help each other!
lender.occupational_info: I do therapy work with all kinds of people, including victims of trauma.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: I want to help others help others. My family and I have been blessed and hope I can in some small way help others...
lender.occupational_info: I support a large university computer infrastructure. I enjoy every day and feel I make a difference...

lender.name: Zakureth
lender.loan_because: Because I can.
lender.occupational_info: Mr. FixIT

lender.name: Glenys
lender.loan_because: I know the struggle of operating a small business and have visited Thailand and Loas and can see what a difference a small amount of our money can make in peoples lives.
lender.occupational_info: I run a Cafe in rural Australia on a highway 60 km from our nearest town.We make all of the products that we sell an our main clients are Tourists and travelers.

lender.loan_because: This is a beautiful way to help people to help themselves.

lender.name: Patrick
lender.loan_because: it is inspiring

lender.name: Nicole
lender.loan_because: I like the idea of small loans on a person to person basis to women who have the courage to start their own business to make a better life for themselves and support their children to get an education. What I find attractive with the Kiva project is that this form of assistance is not charity. A small loan makes such good sense. I wished this project was much more widely known amongst the more affluent of us who despair of our own governments and international organisations failing to tackle poverty and diseases.

lender.name: Emergency Dept
lender.occupational_info: We raise money in our coffee room selling soft drinks to staff members and distribute the money to various causes such as medecins sans frontiers, kiva and world vision.

lender.name: Richard
lender.loan_because: A small amount to us, makes a big difference to them.

lender.name: Melanie
lender.loan_because: i wish to have a business, and am planning to run a general store.
lender.occupational_info: i was once work as area in-charge in private company. I work hard, give 80% of my time for it, after 2 years of working i dont see any movement with my carrer, thats why i resigned. Now, im inviting everyone, to lend me for my starting capital.

lender.loan_because: I try to think globally and act locally. The internet age has drastically reduced the size of our world such that "across the world" is now considered more local than in the past.

lender.name: Bernhard

lender.name: greghunt
lender.loan_because: I realize that I'm extremely lucky to have a stable income with money to spare, and am happy to support entrepreneurs across the world.

lender.loan_because: My kids made a loan to Kiva in my name as a birthday gift. I have since reinvested. As an independent business person I know how important it is to have resources to run a business.
lender.occupational_info: I design interiors of residential and commercial buildings and play bass guitar and upright bass in my spare time.

lender.occupational_info: Whichever of my occupations I do, the human beeing as a whole is who I want to reach. This holistic way is my contribution to make this world a better one.

lender.name: Lydia & Lowell

lender.name: Bethany
lender.loan_because: I appreciate all the opportunities I've had in my life and want to share opportunities with others

lender.name: Rebecca
lender.loan_because: even as a working design student, I know how hard it is to feel good about your future when you don't have much. Taking out loans is understandable and I feel good that despite the fact that I'm tight on money, I still love to help someone else with their dream.

lender.occupational_info: Community Organizing to build sustainable, cross-cultural communities, engaging a healthy democracy

lender.name: rodney

lender.name: Zehen Consulting
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference and have an impact in a small way.

lender.name: Crystal

lender.name: Karen

lender.occupational_info: I help businesses find intelligent solutions to their problems.

lender.name: Lynne

lender.loan_because: I was poor once.

lender.name: Jeni
lender.occupational_info: I work for a large college to make sure that money that is donated goes to the correct places and used correctly.

lender.name: Galen
lender.loan_because: I think people need to do what they love, and kiva helps to empower that.

lender.loan_because: I can.

lender.name: Leon
lender.loan_because: It helps people escape poverty in a sustainable way.

lender.name: Ashley
lender.loan_because: "Live as the world should be, to show it what it can be."
lender.occupational_info: I love my work- Helping people in China to understand the concept of "Organic" and "Fair Trade" since May 2009. It's been a lot of tough work but great experience!

lender.name: Sherry
lender.loan_because: I'd like to help other women have a better life.
lender.occupational_info: My employer is the state department that pays pensions to California's teachers. I have another person working for me and our job is to give information to news reporters who call us.

lender.name: Emily
lender.loan_because: it's a cliche to say "i want to make this world a better place" and then never get around to doing anything about it. I wanted to step out of the cliche, match actions to my words, and support the true determination of these entrepreneurs.

lender.name: Ashwin
lender.loan_because: I can

lender.name: Marie
lender.loan_because: I believe in the power of change, right livelihood, and our connection to one another. We can all make a difference.

lender.name: Mark E
lender.occupational_info: Stay-at-home Dad

lender.name: Brittany
lender.loan_because: i've been blessed, i want to bless others.
lender.occupational_info: Senior (fourth year) at California State University at East Bay. Majoring in Exercise, Nutrition, and Wellness.

lender.name: Paula
lender.loan_because: God has blessed me in many ways. This is an opportunity to give back to society and help those who need a helping hand.

lender.name: Vernon
lender.loan_because: I have been fortunate enough to see people in need from the perspective of sufficiency. Kiva allows me to assist those willing to work their way off the mat by simply circulating capital through the hands of entrepreneurs in developing markets. I can empower a grass-roots version of the capitalist trickle down effect but from a socially responsible bottom-up position. How awesome is that?
lender.occupational_info: I work with major oil companies helping them to ensure the pipelines they build and install are safe for the environment and have a minimal negative impact on the people living and working around them.

lender.name: Norah
lender.loan_because: I'd like it to be a caring and sharing world.

lender.name: Faye
lender.loan_because: Women on their own need support

lender.name: Brian
lender.loan_because: I hope to reduce the amount of suffering in the world.

lender.name: Caleb Flowers
lender.loan_because: It is an incredible opportunity to help positively impact the life of someone in need.
lender.occupational_info: I help school districts in the state of Washington convert to new computer software.

lender.name: Kyle
lender.loan_because: I believe it to be the single most effective way of helping the developing world while instilling dignity and accountability.

lender.name: Steve
lender.loan_because: There is enough for all, provided all share. -Nisargadatta
lender.occupational_info: Computers. Vedanta. Psychedelics.

lender.name: Silvia
lender.loan_because: its the least I can do to help.

lender.name: david
lender.loan_because: It Helps those in need
lender.occupational_info: Finance

lender.name: Karla & Martin
lender.occupational_info: doing research and development in medical informatics (software used in hospitals). The bird is an eurasian jay native to Germany that nested this spring in our roof.

lender.name: Matthew
lender.loan_because: i want to teach a man to fish
lender.occupational_info: law student

lender.name: Osamu & Satomi
lender.loan_because: It makes us happy.

lender.name: TirzaTajunTarjaniTarini
lender.loan_because: I think this is a great way, to enable someone somewhere in the world to improve their living conditions, and I can re-invest the money once the loan is repaid. In this way, one sum can continually help people, rather than being a one-off. Also, it is nice to know that some people, who would be ashamed to receive donations as gifts, can keep their personal dignity intact by repaying the money once they have made an additional income with their loan and thus giving the money free to help somewhere else. I also give money to various other charities, like kidshelp-kambodscha.de, PETA and Greenpeace, etc. - (animals & children cannot pay back loans, of course, same as prisoners of conscience, whom we support via amnesty international) but as we work on a tight budget, being able to continuously re-use the money given here, makes it especially valuable to us as much as to the recipient(s) that we support in this way! Great system!
lender.occupational_info:
After breaking off a BA in Comparative Religious & Indonesian Studies and while working as waitress and assistant manager in various London food & bevarage companies, I graduated in HND in Leisure & Tourism Management & BA in Tourism Studies & Marketing, after which I became a mother and jet-setting could no longer be part of my job,... I moved back home to Germany after 8 years in the UK. I am a family manager. I have three children, born 99, 02 & 07 respectively (see picture) and am a Reiki Master and teacher. I cannot divorce my private life and my professional life. I live by my ideals (social awareness, being a vegetarian, helping others, spirituality, etc.) What I believe in, I live by, and that pervades all areas of our lives. I also involve my children in all aspects of my life in a way that is coherent with their various ages. For example, I help out a lot n primary school, lending out toys during breaks, help in my daughter's class with various projects, am secretary of the school's fundraising committee, or I organize the goodbye party for my son's English teacher who's just left for the US. Also, I take part in the annual Fairytales for X-mas at kindergarden. Each year, some parents perform a little fairytale play for the children at the annual Christmas Party. In spring, we do gardening at the nursery, etc. There is always something to do - and somuch to learn from the children who are often wiser than their parents... ;) As a family we also discuss and decide on how we spend our money, where charities and other bigger expenses are concerned. My daughter Tarjani (middle child) said on the topic of Kiva: "This is great! When we get some more money next month, we can give a loan to yet another person and when both are paid back, we can give double the amount to a third person, and maybe we can give some more in-between still, and just think of how many people we can help with this! It grows over time! This is great! This is REALLY GREAT!" You should have seen the beam on the face of my then 5-year-old girl, being happy about helping people, happier than she ever was about receiving gifts herself! When someone asks me why I've decided to put children into this "bad world", I tell them, they are angels come to make this world a better place. And they prove me right with every smile & grand vision they voice, that lights up their faces & hearts! I wish for all children in the world to have the same great opportunities and safety as my children have! And when I am not busy with them, I am continuing to write on my books. Children always come first, of course! :-)
Love and Light to all,
Tirza, Tajun, Tarjani & Tarini

lender.name: William Logai
lender.occupational_info:
Hope Ofiriha was founded by 12 widows in Lofiriha on July 27th, 1999. The charity is registered with Magwi County local government - Department of community services.
Initially the charity assisted widows only, to identify and implement solutions to a variety of problems confronting them in the rural areas during the war. Local training and other projects promoting the conditions of widows were initiated. Since its inception, William Logai Ochieng and Linda Acen Abili re â started Hope ofiriha in 2006. They broaden its original purpose and begun to encompass projects beyond those narrowly aimed at widowâs training.The charity subsequently embarked to promote the issues affecting women, girls, and children as a whole in Lofiriha community, Magwi County, Sudan. 3 images places here
Ochieng and Abili have interest for Lofiriha people and in particular the area and the people around Omiling, where the charity is based. Ochieng brings a broad of commercial experience to Hope ofiriha, after having run his own business for several years and Abili has an administrative background from Juba University. Putting together their skills has meant that the charity has developed into anefficient, a fun and well organised organisation. They are realists, not idealists, and believing in giving a hand up, not a hand out!
They feel it is important that costs are kept to a minimum â for example, the design and maintenance of the website and all administrative work is done by them at no cost to the charity.
Hope ofiriha only employs local people, mostly women, and they are responsible for the day to day running of the projects. Ochieng and Abili are in daily contact with the senior managers, who provide progress reports on the projects. Ochieng regularly visits Lofiriha community to keep an eye on how the charity is running and to develop new programmes. They spend time training and empowering Hope ofiriha`s managers and staff, and meeting with members of the Lofiriha local community in most cases.
Hope ofiriha is different to most charities working in Sudan. So much money is spent on administration, monitoring, report writing, inefficient systems, etc., that very little money actually finds its way to the people who the donors wished to help. Hope ofiriha is based at Omiling and has minimal local overheads. The charity deals directly with the local communities, and it is made clear that Hope ofiriha helps people who help themselves. The charity often acts as a catalyst to make things happen.
Hope ofiriha has 425 local Lofiriha members who generously support the charity with their donations.
Hope ofiriha is involved with education, micro âloans, child sponsorship, and healthcare locally to Lofiriha community. It is also actively involved in an environmental tree planting and reforestation project in Onura which covers an area of 2,000 Sq.km.

lender.name: WholeKidsAdventure
lender.loan_because: ...of the amazing success stories!!! I believe in helping people who are willing to help themselves!
lender.occupational_info:
Whole Kids Adventure, a Texas domestic non-profit corporation, was organized to provide a unique child development model that will focus on establishing healthy eating habits and increasing physical activity levels in preschool age children and their families in order to prevent the development of obesity and related health problems. We will provide health education for our WKA families and the general public!
Our priority is child obesity, an issue that influences most families in America. We are concerned about the growing obesity epidemic in children, and adolescents, a trend that will have social consequences throughout life.
We are currently establishing partnerships with organizations that support our WKA mission, and in addition we are working with local farms to set up a Food Co-Op to allow not only our children but also our families to enjoy fresh organic produce at an affordable rate directly from the farm!
In addition to the Co-op, we are starting a Gardening program and will be setting up Community Garden(s) WITH and FOR our families. We are focused to GROW WITH and HELP EXPAND the LOCAL FOOD CULTURE!
Our first location will be non-toxic and environmentally friendly...
